doc.after: Mining in Europe has a very long history Examples include the silver mines of Laurium which helped support the Greek city state of Athens However it is the Romans who developed large scale mining methods especially the use of large volumes of water brought to the minehead by numerous aqueducts The water was used for a variety of purposes including removing overburden and rock debris called hydraulic mining as well as washing comminuted or crushed ores and driving simple machinery
